parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To mock, ridicule. From en and paizo; to jeer at, i.e. Deride.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From ek and the base of duno; to cause to sink out of, i.e. to divest.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A short cloak, worn by military officers and soldiers. Of uncertain derivation; a military cloak.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lead, carry, take away; met: To be led astray, seduced. From apo and ago; to take off.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.
